Original Scenario: Attacker sends an automated response from the victim's account after the AI Agent marks the issue as resolved, thus reopening the ticket and delaying its actual closure.

New Attack Scenario: The attacker sets up a rule on the victim's email account to forward any emails received from the AI Agent to an address they control. A user with an account access issue sends a message to the helpdesk system, which is automatically resolved and closed by the system. In this case, when the system receives the automated response from the user, it misclassifies the message as a new issue or request, thus re-opening the ticket and potentially delaying the resolution of the actual account access problem.
